data.selection_rationale: M2 achieved the lowest average MAE (2.328) compared to M1 (4.678) and M3 (4.340), while maintaining high R2 score (0.9997).
data.method_comparison_summary: M2 (Linear Regression) outperformed both baseline (M1) and ML (M3) approaches with 50.7% lower MAE than M1 and 4.7% lower MAE than M3
data.winning_method_code:
def predict_linear_regression(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
    # Use all previous area columns as features
    features = ['Area-2020-21', 'Area-2021-22', 'Area-2022-23', 'Area-2023-24']
    X_train = train_df[features]
    y_train = train_df[target_col]
    X_test = test_df[features]
    model = LinearRegression().fit(X_train, y_train)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
